articles.excerpt: Northrop & Johnson hosted the 2020 Winter Captain and Crew Cocktails on the deck at Yot Bar and Kitchen overlooking the docks at Lauderdale Marine Center on Feb. 6. About 150 yacht captains, crew and businesses from the Fort Lauderdale yard attended and networked with food, drinks, and live music. Photos by Dorie Cox and

articles.title: Next Triton Event: Networking with Lewis Marine
articles.author: Lucy Chabot Reed
articles.excerpt: By Lucy Chabot Reed Our second Triton Networking event in February is on the third Wednesday, Feb. 19, at Lewis Marine Supply. Make plans to join us from 6-8 p.m. at the warehouse in Fort Lauderdale to meet with and talk to the team at Lewis about the new ownership, their new yacht-focused concierge service,

articles.title: Triton networks with The Yacht Group
articles.author: Dorie Cox
articles.excerpt: More than 225 yacht captains, crew and industry professionals gathered on 17th Street in Fort Lauderdale for Triton Networking with The Yacht Group on the first Wednesday in February. Attendees toured the showroom, tested equipment, and enjoyed snacks and beverages. Photos by Dorie Cox and Tom Serio. To see these photos on Facebook, click here.

articles.title: Yacht crew compete, learn in Caribbean Crewfest
articles.author: Triton Staff
articles.excerpt: Crew from 18 yachts kept busy with education and exercise during the 5th annual Caribbean Crewfest hosted by Acrew in January. The four-day event at IGY Yacht Haven Grande Marina in St. Thomas saw 120 crew participate in eight workshops on topics including roll-period, leadership, cigars, cyber security, flowers, hospitality, data and bandwidth management, and

articles.title: Triton networks with Culinary Convenience
articles.author: Dorie Cox
articles.excerpt: More than 250 yacht captains, crew and industry professionals gathered for our first Triton Networking of 2020 at Culinary Convenience, a one-stop chef and stew supply company in Fort Lauderdale. The company offered our guests live music, three kinds of made-on-site paella and cold local brews. Our monthly events -- held the first and third

articles.title: Antigua19: Crew shine through rain drops
articles.author: Triton Staff
articles.excerpt: Yacht crew kept their chamois close during rain showers at this years Antigua Charter Yacht Show. Showings and yacht hops went on during the show, which ran Dec. 4-9 and covered three locations at the Antigua Yacht Club Marina, Falmouth Harbour Marina, and Nelson's Dockyard Marina. Photos by Billy Black

articles.title: 200 celebrate at Triton Networking with Maritime Marine
articles.author: Tom Serio
articles.excerpt: About 200 people enjoyed a Polynesian-inspired Triton Networking event last night at Maritime Marine in Fort Lauderdale. The team and staff at the switchboard automation company also celebrated the 75th birthday of company founder Malcolm Parton. We wish everyone a happy holiday. Join us for Triton Networking again on Jan. 15. Photos by Tom Serio

articles.title: Triton Networks with Admiral Canvas
articles.author: Tom Serio
articles.excerpt: A luau-themed Triton Networking event last night brought about 200 yacht captains, crew and industry professionals to Admiral Yacht Canvas and Upholstery in Fort Lauderdale on the first Wednesday of the month. Guests were treated to a Hawaiian barbecue and Polynesian dancers. Join us again next week for one final Triton Networking of 2019. Photos by

articles.title: The Triton networks with Baglietto
articles.author: Dorie Cox
articles.excerpt: More than 200 captains, crew and industry joined us for Triton Networking last night with Italian yacht builder Baglietto. Our guests enjoyed a tour of Baglietto's production offices, which it shares with Bertram Yachts, and mingled under cool, clear South Florida skies. Our hosts raffled off high performance shirts and The Triton handed crew our

articles.title: Sip and See event at Bluewater Books and Charts
articles.author: Dorie Cox
articles.excerpt: Fort Lauderdale-based Bluewater Books and Charts hosted a Sip and See event last night with yacht captains, crew and industry pros. About 100 people enjoyed wine tastings, hors d'oeuvres and live music as they strolled the store and met most of the other businesses that share the warehouse space. Photos by Dorie Cox

articles.title: Triton Networking with Ronnie’s at UMC
articles.author: Tom Serio
articles.excerpt: Just days after the Fort Lauderdale International Boat Show, more than 200 yacht captains, crew and business professionals gathered for Triton Networking in Fort Lauderdale. Many long-time friends and new acquaintances enjoyed Brazilian barbecue with beverages under the tiki hut at Universal Marine Center with Ronnies Custom Carpet Cleaning on the first Wednesday in November.

articles.title: FLIBS19: Crew shine as show gets busy over the weekend
articles.author: Tom Serio
articles.excerpt: Under awnings, umbrellas, and from the inside, yachts crew were dressed and ready to greet visitors on a busy Saturday during the 60th edition of the Fort Lauderdale boat show. New to the charter market, M/Y Cynthia, a 182-foot Feadship, reported being busy showing the yacht to dozens of charter brokers. Photos by Tom Serio

articles.title: FLIBS19: Calliope captain wins Fraser fleet honor
articles.author: Lucy Chabot Reed
articles.excerpt: Story and photo by Lucy Chabot Reed Capt. Adam Connolly of M/Y Calliope, a 150-foot RMK, was named Frasers Yacht Management Captain of the Year for 2019 last night In announcing the award, Fraser Global Marketing Manager Lisa Peck described Capt. Connolly as soft spoken, results driven, and a great motivator. The award was presented

articles.title: FLIBS19: Weekend arrives at the Oasis Lounge
articles.author: Lucy Chabot Reed
articles.excerpt: Saturday was fun day in the Oasis Lounge where crew brought smiles and laughter to lunchtime. Some may blame the lighter attitude on the heat; we say crew were channeling their inner end-of-show selves. In either case, lunch and the patio were full of smiles. Photos by Lucy Chabot Reed

articles.title: FLIBS19: Guests get treats as chefs compete
articles.author: Dorie Cox
articles.excerpt: By Dorie Cox Guests to the second edition of the Sunset Soiree & Yacht Chef Competition were treated to taste sensations from four yacht industry chefs on Friday evening during the Fort Lauderdale International Boat Show. Chef Danny Davies of M/Y Excellence, a 150-foot Richmond, was honored as Best Yacht Chef in the boat show.

articles.title: FLIBS19: Crew gather for rugby finals
articles.author: Lucy Chabot Reed
articles.excerpt: About 200 crew gathered before dawn on Saturday to catch the live telecast of the Rugby World Cup finals game between South Africa and England. Coconuts restaurant opened early to make room for the event. We always knew it was going to come on at 5 a.m. and that crew had to be on station

articles.title: FLIBS19: Oasis offers cool, magical break from show
articles.author: Lucy Chabot Reed
articles.excerpt: More crew from the main docks found their way to the Oasis Lounge yesterday, traveling both by Oasis tender (at the Moran dock) and by shuttle bus to enjoy the lunchtime camaraderie. Magician/mentalist John Born stopped by yesterday to dazzle a few crew with his sophisticated magic. Photos by Lucy Chabot Reed

articles.title: FLIBS19: Bahamas relief efforts shine light on Distinguished Crew
articles.author: Lucy Chabot Reed
articles.excerpt: By Dorie Cox and Lucy Chabot Reed Two days after Hurricane Dorian s 185 mph winds and relentless rains hit the northern Bahamas, Capt. Paul Clarke and the crew of M/Y Loon arrived in the Abacos to help. The 155-foot Christensen, loaded with a 28-person disaster aid team and donated relief supplies, was the first yacht

articles.title: FLIBS19: Crew, yachts look their best
articles.author: Triton Staff
articles.excerpt: Yacht crew are spotted on the job and off-duty from north in Las Olas Marina through Hall of Fame and Bahia Mar to both north and south docks at Pier Sixty-Six Marina yesterday at the Fort Lauderdale International Boat Show. Photos by Tom Serio, Dorie Cox and Lucy Reed
